body.p:
Catlettsburg Ky
Nov 19th 1864
Thomas E Bramlett Esqr
Govenor of Ky
Sir --

Some time since a petition was sent from Laurence County in behalf of my brother W F Moore asking the remission of Two fines assessed against him in the Laurence Circuit Court at its April Term 1864 one for $60, and one for $20. and costs for keeping a Tippling house in the first case and selling liquor by retail in the other,

The facts were, that my brother was a partner of N. D Rheadhead in the the Sutlers department of the 14th Ky Regiment and his partner sold whiskey against the wish and protest of my brother, -- and the partnership having been dissolved before court and my brother remaining the Sutler they indicted him theHe ceased to sell liquor as soon
he got controll of the business and has sold none Since I enclose you a letter from the attorney of the commonwealth who prosecuted the cases which was written soon after the fines were assessed it speaks for itself, I hope you will find it consistent with your official duty to remitt these fines

I am Sir you obt Srvt & friend
Laban T Moore

Lawrence Cir Ct
vs
W. F. Moore
2 judgts
$60 & $20
Tipling
Remitd.
25th Nov/64
